item.title: nuevo post
item.description: ####Eggs PER PLANT #### Sub.Eggs <- subset(mydata, select=c(Nger, Isolate, EggsP) ) ##Create a subset of the desire variable Eggs per plant: MIAd ####Isolate: MIAd#### Sub.Eggs.MIAd <- subset(Sub.Eggs, Isolate == "MIAd", select=c(Nger, EggsP)) Sub.Eggs.MIAd$Nger = factor (Sub.Eggs.MIAd$Nger, labels=c("EC", "TB", "TE", "TS", "TT")) ###Descriptive statistics calculation### Sub.Eggs.MIAd.EC <- subset(Sub.Eggs.MIAd, Nger == "EC", select=c(Nger, EggsP)) Me.EP.MIAd.EC <- mean(Sub.Eggs.MIAd.EC$EggsP, na.mr=FALSE) Me.EP.MIAd.EC <- round(Me.EP.MIAd.EC, digits=2) Se.EP.MIAd.EC <- se(Sub.Eggs.MIAd.EC$EggsP) Se.EP.MIAd.EC <- round(Se.EP.MIAd.EC, digits=2) Sub.Eggs.MIAd.SB <- subset(Sub.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com.
